results.title: The French doors
results.brief_description: A man is renovating his home and adds a set of French doors to the house. When he wakes the next morning the world has taken a dramatic turn into the unknown.

results.title: The French connection (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Philip D'Antoni and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: Jimmy “Popeye” Doyle and his partner, Buddy Russo, are New York City police detectives in the field of narcotics. Piecing bits of evidence together they unravel the workings of one of the largest drug-deals in history, involving a massive shipment of heroin from France to the United States. Doyle and Russo tail local New Yorkers Sal Boca and Angie who run a modest, small corner store, yet lead an exuberant and glamorous social life. The policemen slowly figure out this couple’s connection to Charnier, the French kingpin who is smuggling a large quantity of heroin into the city. A riveting car-chase sequence plus a textured, inventive soundscape, keeps “The French connection” engaging throughout. Most admirable is its fusion of art house stylistics with the genre action pic. Cast includes: Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco.

results.title: The French 'U'
results.brief_description: A class of boys from Heath Clark School, England, demonstrate the action of the mouth, lips, and tongue for the correct pronunciation of the French vowel sound “u”.

results.title: The Freedom railway
results.brief_description: Looks at the Tan-Zam Railway (known locally as the Freedom Railway) which the Chinese have helped to build in Africa. 14,000 Chinese, working day and night with 40,000 Africans, have pushed this railway 1,900 kilometres from Dar es Salaam on the Indian Ocean to Kapiri Mposhi in the heart of Africa. The film conveys how the Chinese and Africans live, in their work camps, and the relationship which has developed between peoples of such different cultures.

results.title: The Frazers of Cabot Cove
results.creator_credit: Green Park Productions, Central Office of Intormation, Paul Fletcher and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: Set against the background of outpost life in Newfoundland, once Britain’s oldest colony and now Canada’s tenth province, the film tells the love-story of Mary Frazer and shows the lives and problems of the simple fishing community in which she lives.

results.title: The Frank Sinatra Timex show
results.brief_description: A television variety show hosted by Frank Sinatra with special guests Dean Martin, Bing Crosby, Mitzi Gaynor and Jimmy Durante. An entertaining program with lots of music, dance and witty conversation and featuring some of Sinatra’s all-time favourites. Music direction by Nelson Riddle.

results.title: The Frank Sinatra show
results.brief_description: The Frank Sinatra Show screened as a television variety series during the years 1950-1952 and 1957-1958, hosted by Frank Sinatra along with a selection of regular and special guest stars. This particular program features Jack Benny, the well-known American comedian (and host of his own TV show), supported by singer June Hutton, comedian Larry Griswold, and child violinist Charles Castleman. Frank not only sings but also plays a comedy role alongside Jack Benny to present an entertaining mix of comedy sketches and music. Songs include “I’ve got my love to keep me warm”, “My concerto”, “For you” and “What is America to me”. Added bonus (or not) is this program also includes commericals by the sponsor promoted by the stars of the show. Music by Axel Stordahl.

results.title: The Franck-Hertz experiment
results.creator_credit: Educational Services, Physical Sciences Study Committee and Jack Churchill
results.brief_description: A stream of electrons is accelerated through mercury vapour, and it is shown that the kinetic energy of the electrons is transferred to the mercury atoms only in discreet packets of energy. The association of the quantum of energy with a line in the spectrum of mercury is established. The experiment retraced in this film was one of the earliest indications of the existence of internal energy states within the atom.

results.title: The Fox went out on a chilly night
results.brief_description: Set in New England on an autumn night, this story is about a clever fox who, foraging for food in the village, outwits a farmer to bring a sumptuous meal back to his family in their den. The splendid watercolour illustrations have a light touch, are very expressive and humorous, and convey a wonderful sense of movement. They are used here to create a small film where the story is sung liltingly and clearly by Molly Scott. First the story is sung with most of the book’s images, then the song is repeated with the words on the screen to follow/sing along with. A good aid for those wanting to teach the song to children (all seven verses). Based on the book of the same name by Peter Spier which originated from the 1945 Burl Ives adaption of an old folk song. Spier’s novel was a Caldecott Honor Book winner in 1962 for best illustration in a children’s book. Suitable for children all ages.
